info.title: NLPearl Client API
info.description: A sample API that demonstrates features in the OpenAPI specification

200.description: Client information

get.description: Retrieves all the information about a call

parameters.name: callId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the call to retrieve information for.

200.description: Client informations

requestBody.description: The request object containing the list of call IDs to be deleted.

schema.description: Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.
Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.
Represents the request object used to delete one or more calls.

200.description: Returns a boolean indicating if the deletion was successful.
List of all inbound for the client.

get.description: Retrieves a specific inbound by its ID

parameters.name: inboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the inbound.

200.description: Details of the specific inbound.

get.description: Returns the number of active calls currently in progress and in queue for the specified inbound ID.

parameters.name: inboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the inbound.

200.description: Details of the specific inbound.

post.description: Run or Pause a specific inbound

parameters.name: inboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the inbound.

requestBody.description: The request containing the desired active state.

schema.description: Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.
Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.
Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.

200.description: The active state of the inbound.

post.description: Retrieves the calls within a specific date range of inbound

parameters.name: inboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the inbound configuration.

requestBody.description: The search criteria including date range and sorting parameters.

200.description: Calls within the specified date range for inbound.

post.description: Retrieves analytics data for a specific inbound campaign within a given date range.

parameters.name: inboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the inbound campaign.

requestBody.description:
The object containing the start and end dates for the analytics query.  
The maximum allowed range between the start and end date is 90 days.

schema.description: Represents a date range used to query analytics data.
Represents a date range used to query analytics data.
Represents a date range used to query analytics data.

200.description: Returns an object containing the analytics data for the specified outbound campaign.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed outbound ID, or errors in the search parameters.

200.description: A list of outbounds.

get.description: Retrieve a specific outbound by its ID

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound.

200.description: Detailed view of a specific outbound.

post.description: Activates or deactivates a specified outbound

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound.\n\nRetreive it in [Get outbound](api-reference/outbound/get-outbounds)

requestBody.description: The request containing the activation state.

put.description: Adds a new lead to a specified outbound

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign to which the lead will be added.

requestBody.description: The lead details to be added to the outbound campaign.

200.description: Id of the added lead.

put.description: Updates the details of an existing lead associated with a specific outbound campaign.

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign.

parameters.name: leadId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the lead to update.

schema.description:
Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

200.description: The updated lead is returned.

400.description: The request is invalid or the data is malformed.

post.description: Initiates an outbound phone call associated with the specified outbound ID. The request body must contain the necessary details for making the call. Once initiated, the call will be routed to the first available agent.

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign for which the call is being initiated.

requestBody.description: The details required to make the outbound phone call, encapsulated in an NLPearl.Core.Models.OutboundMakeCallRequest object.

schema.description: Defines the request structure for making an outbound call.
Defines the request structure for making an outbound call.
Defines the request structure for making an outbound call.

200.description: The outbound phone call was successfully initiated and the active state is returned.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed outbound ID, or errors in the call request details.

get.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific API request identified by its unique requestId.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the API request to retrieve.

200.description: The details of the API request were successfully retrieved.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed requestId.

post.description: Fetches a list of API call requests associated with a specific outbound identifier. The search criteria, such as filters or pagination options, should be provided in the request body.

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign for which the API call requests are being retrieved.

requestBody.description: The search criteria, including filters or pagination options, provided in the request body.

schema.description: Extends TableSearch to include date filtering for more specific searches.
Extends TableSearch to include date filtering for more specific searches.
Extends TableSearch to include date filtering for more specific searches.

200.description: A list of API call requests related to the specified outbound ID was successfully retrieved.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed outbound ID, or errors in the search parameters.

post.description: Retrieves analytics data for a specific outbound campaign within a given date range.

parameters.name: outboundId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign.

requestBody.description:
The object containing the start and end dates for the analytics query.  
The maximum allowed range between the start and end date is 90 days.

schema.description: Represents a date range used to query analytics data.
Represents a date range used to query analytics data.

200.description: Returns an object containing the analytics data for the specified outbound campaign.

400.description: The request was invalid. Possible causes include a missing or malformed outbound ID, or errors in the search parameters.

put.description: Resets stored memory associated with a specific customer's phone number for a given Pearl.

parameters.name: pearlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl whose memory should be reset.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number associated with the customer whose memory should be reset.

200.description: Memory reset successful.

callsByHourDayOfWeeks.description: Breakdown of calls by hour and day of the week.

id.description: The unique identifier of the API request.

outboundId.description: The unique identifier of the outbound campaign associated with this API request.

created.description: The date and time when the API request was created.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred during the API request, if any.

callId.description: The unique identifier of the call associated with this API request, if available.

count.description: The total number of items matching the search criteria.

results.description: The list of results for the current page, based on the search criteria.

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

pearlId.description: The unique identifier of the Pearl (API v2).

relatedId.description: The unique identifier of the inbound/outbound (API v1).

startTime.description: The date and time when the call processing started.

conversationStatus.description:
The outcome of the conversation during the call.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

status.description:
Represents the current status of a call.

`3 - InProgress`

`4 - Completed`

`5 - Busy`

`6 - Failed`

`7 - NoAnswer`

`8 - Canceled`

to.description: The phone number to which the call was made.

name.description: The name associated with the call, if available.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

recording.description: The URL of the recording of the call, if available.

transcript.description: The transcript of the conversation, represented as a list of chat messages.

collectedInfo.description: A List containing information collected during the call.

tags.description: The tags or labels triggered during the conversation

isCallTransferred.description: Indicates whether the call was transferred to a human or another endpoint.

overallSentiment.description:
Represents the overall emotional tone detected from the client during the conversation.

`1 - Negative`

`2 - SlightlyNegative`

`3 - Neutral`

`4 - SlightlyPositive`

`5 - Positive`

`1 - New`

created.description: The date and time when the lead was created.

callsId.description: The list of the ID's of all the calls this lead has received.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.
see [Variables](/pages/variables) for more information.
Here is an example of the json to send:
`{ "email" : "joe@gmail.com", "address": "3 Abbey Road UK" , "carLicense" : "90-929-82" }`

collectedData.description:
A dictionary containing all the information collected about the lead during the call.  
These values are the result of the conversation and reflect the answers or actions taken by the lead.  
The `key` represents the ID of the variable configured on the platform,  
and the `value` corresponds to the collected data.  
            
This information can be used to understand user intent, track specific responses, or power further automation.  
For more details on how variables work, see [Variables](/pages/variables).
            
Here is an example of the JSON format:
`{ "confirmBooking": true, "dropOffLocation": "Orly Airport", "rideTime": "Friday at 12:00", "userIntent": "Book a taxi to the airport" }`

id.description: The unique identifier of the call.

pearlId.description: The ID of the Pearl Used in This Call.

Represents the current status of a call.

`8 - Canceled`

LeadSearch.description: Extends TableSearch to include specific search criteria for leads.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the lead.

externalId.description: An optional external identifier for the lead.

timeZoneId.description:
Optional time zone identifier for the lead.  
If provided, this will override the default time zone configured at the outbound level.  
By default, an outbound campaign has a predefined time zone (set during creation or modified later on the platform),  
but you can assign a specific time zone to a lead by specifying this property.  

If not provided, the lead will use the outbound's default time zone.  

For valid values, refer to the "TimeZone" column in the following list:  
[Time Zone List](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11) 

Examples: `"Pacific Standard Time"`, `"Trkiye Standard Time"`

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.

See [Variables](/pages/variables) for more information.
Here is an example of the json to send:

`{ "email" : "joe@gmail.com", "address": "3 Abbey Road UK" , "carLicense" : "90-929-82" }`

phoneNumber.description:
The updated phone number of the lead.  
If provided, it will replace the existing phone number.

externalId.description:
An updated external identifier for the lead.  
This can be used to link the lead with external systems.

timeZoneId.description:
Optional time zone identifier for the lead.  
If set, this overrides the default time zone configured on the outbound.  
For accepted values, refer to the [Windows Time Zones list](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/manufacture/desktop/default-time-zones?view=windows-11).  
Example: `"Pacific Standard Time"`, `"Trkiye Standard Time"`.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional lead information.  
These values can be used in the Pearl's "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script".  
The `key` is the variable ID and the `value` is its value.  
See [Variables](/pages/variables) for more details.  
Example: `{ "email": "joe@gmail.com", "carLicense": "90-929-82" }`

status.description:
The new status to assign to the lead.

This can be used to update the lead's progression or interaction result.

For example, if you want the outbound campaign to stop calling this lead, you can set the status to `Completed`.
Or, if the lead already converted successfully in an external CRM, you can mark it directly as `Success`.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

LeadToUpdateApi.description:
Represents the data used to update an existing lead in an outbound campaign.
All fields are optional; only the provided values will be updated.

callData.description:
A dictionary containing additional information about the call.
It is used as variables that you can use in "Opening Sentence" or "Flow Script" when you create a Pearl on the platform.
The keys represent the field names, and the values contain the corresponding data.
This information can be used to personalize the conversation or manage lead-specific details.
This parameter is optional.

Here is an example of the json to send:

OutboundMakeCallRequest.description: Defines the request structure for making an outbound call.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Request. This Request ID can be used to track or reference the specific call request from [Get Call Request](/api-reference/outbound/get-call-request).

from.description:
The phone number from which the call was made. 
This is the originating number used in the outbound call.

to.description:
The phone number to which the call was made. 
This is the destination number that was dialed.

queuePosition.description: The position of the call in the queue if the call is placed in a waiting queue.

OutboundMakeCallResult.description: Defines the result structure for an outbound call operation.

isActive.description:
A boolean value that specifies the new active status of the entity.

True activates the entity, while false deactivates it.

SetActiveRequest.description: Defines the request structure for setting the active status of an entity.

skip.description: Number of entries to skip for pagination.

limit.description: Limit on the number of entries to return.

isAscending.description: Whether the sort order is ascending.

fromDate.description: The start date for filtering the search results.

toDate.description: The end date for filtering the search results.

TableDateSearch.description: Extends TableSearch to include date filtering for more specific searches.

eActivityStatus.description:
Here is the activity status

`1 - Running`

`2 - Paused`

`3 - Suspended`

`10 - TemporaryMaintenance`

eCallAuthorizationStatus.description:
Represents the authorization status for making calls.

`1 - FullAccess`

`2 - LimitedAccess`

`3 - NoCredits`

`4 - SuspendedAccount`

`5 - DebtReached`

eCallStatusView.description:
Represents the current status of a call.

`3 - InProgress`

`4 - Completed`

`5 - Busy`

`6 - Failed`

`7 - NoAnswer`

`8 - Canceled`

eConversationStatusView.description:
The outcome of the conversation during the call.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

eLeadStatusInputApi.description:
The new status to assign to the lead.

This can be used to update the lead's progression or interaction result.

For example, if you want the outbound campaign to stop calling this lead, you can set the status to `Completed`.
Or, if the lead already converted successfully in an external CRM, you can mark it directly as `Success`.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

eLeadStatusInputView.description:
`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`30 - WrongCountryCode`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`200 - Deleted`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`500 - Error`

eLeadStatusView.description:
The Status of the lead is the status of the last conversation.

To determine the definition of 'Success' or 'Not Successful,' please refer to the [Create a Pearl](/pages/create_pearl#pearl-name) page at step 4.

`1 - New`

`10 - NeedRetry`

`20 - InCallQueue`

`30 - WrongCountryCode`

`40 - OnCall`

`70 - VoiceMailLeft`

`100 - Success`

`110 - NotSuccessful`

`130 - Completed`

`150 - Unreachable`

`220 - Blacklisted`

`300 - QueueAbandon`

`500 - Error`

eOverallSentiment.description:
Represents the overall emotional tone detected from the client during the conversation.

`1 - Negative`

`2 - SlightlyNegative`

`3 - Neutral`

`4 - SlightlyPositive`

`5 - Positive`

bearer_auth.description:
Specify the authorization token.

For more information, check out the [Authorization Guide](/api-reference/authorization).
